title: Service Technician - Core IT Services
description:
**S E R V I C E T E C H N I C I A N**  

***L e v e l 1***  

**\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_**  

Full-time | Permanent | Goteborg

 **A B O U T X E N I T**  

Xenit is a Swedish consulting firm which specializes in Cloud and Modern Work. Our committed employees inspire, challenge and encourage each other, while providing extensive value for our customers.  

Xenit is **Microsoft's Partner of the Year Sweden** for 2024; illustrating our commitment to technical development, being on the cutting edge of tech, and our close partnership with Microsoft.  

  

  



**W H A T W E N E E D**  

We are looking for someone to join our **Core IT Services** department as a **Service Technician;** which is essentially a *first line* *support role.*  

We're looking for someone who has *dabbled* in IT (easily knows their way around a computer and the Microsoft suite, troubleshooting to fix issues when things don't work) but isn't an expert by any means. Maybe you've found that you're good with technology at home? Perhaps you're particularly service-minded, and are aiming to get into the tech field?  

  

We're looking for someone who will be the first port of call for customer issues (both via email and telephone) and who is confident in dealing with managers and technical personnel. Much of the role will revolve around **technical dispatching** (receiving, assigning and prioritising tickets), but you will also get a chance to learn valuable IT skills, as well as take important certificates.  

  

Our Core IT department consists of four levels, with those in the final level focused on helping specialised delivery teams and learning how to be an independent consultant.
  

You will make your way up the ladder by completing certain technical tasks/projects, studying/taking certs and showing a positive, can-do attitude.  

  

**Examples of tasks/responsibilities as a Service Technician:**  

* Tasks such as: resetting passwords, troubleshooting PC start-up problems, access issues, printer issues
* Learning Xenit's routines, procedures and systems, and being on top of documentation
* Assisting customers **over the phone**, as well as via email
* Learning when to tackle issues independently and when to escalate to a colleague
* Completing certificationssuch as: **AZ-900, MS-900, SC-900** **and ITIL**
 **C O U L D Y O U B E A M A T C H ?**  

**We believe our Service Technician has:**  

* A basic understanding of IT
* A positive attitude
* An interest in learning
* Preferably previous experience in an IT related field, but if not, in customer service.

  

**We also believe that you are a person who:**  

* Collaborates effectively with others and builds good relationships with colleagues
* Communicates effectively
* Speaks fluent **Swedish** and **English**
* Above all, displays kindness in everything they do

  

**W H Y C H O O S E X E N I T ?**  

**Benefits**  

Xenit boasts a large benefits package - read full list here  

  

**Super interesting colleagues**  

With us you will find spinning instructors, parkour practitioners, gamers, art historians, rugby players, puzzle maniacs, film geeks and much more.  

With us, you are free to be who you are. Our workforce is so diverse, that one of the only things each person has in common is an incredible drive and passion for what they do.  

  

**Activities**  

Each quarter, we have **Xenit Inspire** where employees are able to share specialist knowledge, information about cool projects, and take part in tasks centered around innovation - workshops and hackathons. We also offer annual conferences, team building "after works" and "bring a buddy" lunches
  

  

Xenit was also recently awarded **"Career Company of 2024"**. This prestigious recognition underscores our commitment to fostering a workplace culture that values inclusivity, well-being, and growth.  

*"Xenit is an outstanding employer where corporate culture and well-being are at the center. Here, the employees are part of a warm and inclusive community where their well-being and well-being are prioritized. By offering an environment where collaboration, creativity and innovation are encouraged, employees can thrive and develop while contributing to the company's success."*  

Read more about Karriar Företagen here.

  

If you have questions about the position or the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact our Head of Talent: Abigail Chapman
  

Read more here: https://xenit.se/

*Application information may be shared, in some instances, within the co-native group.*

title: Desktop Engineer L1
description:
**Key Responsibilities**
* Provide on-site and desk-side support services to end users.
* Troubleshoot PC-related problems at the direction of CLIENT level 2 or SPOC.
* Complete incidents and requests within SLA in a pressurized environment.
* Build, configure and troubleshoot Install “Gold” image on customer PC and laptop applications and hardware components.
* Ensure tickets are updated on a daily basis.
* Support meeting room environment and video conferencing.
* Support printers, scanners, and other peripherals.
* Support mobile devices, such as iPads, iPhones, and Android devices.
* End-User Data backup and restoration when required in the course of a service incident.
* Smart hands support for data center equipment as per required SLA (in specified locations)
* As directed by CLIENT Tech support will assist in troubleshooting the data center devices
* Replace defective components cards in data center equipment’s as advised by CLIENT Tech Support e.g., Remove a module and replace it, reconnecting patch cables. Daily tape change in support of local Backup Routine in required sites
* Import /Export tapes to the tape libraries as advised by CLIENT tech support.


**Behavioral Skills Required:**
* The individual must have good customer-facing skills and be well presented.
* Demonstrates independent and pro-active thinking
* Builds effective relationships both within the team and across the business and Professional Services
* Must be able to work to specified standards and required levels of deportment, conduct, and sound ethical workplace practices.
* Must be able to work alone and unsupervised, taking the initiative when necessary.
* Must be organized and prioritize work appropriately.
* Fully vaccinated techs


**Technical Skills & Experience Required**
* Must have experience of using a call logging system.
* Must have good working knowledge of Windows 7/10 and related Office applications.
* Support experience of MACs would be beneficial
* Knowledge of mobile devices, in particular Androids and iPhones
* Working knowledge of current and legacy hardware platforms. Experience with building, configuring, replacing and troubleshooting PC and laptop hardware components.
* Familiarity with Microsoft SCCM.
* Ability to replace defective parts, as identified by CLIENT.
* Excellent hands-on experience in installation and troubleshooting DC equipment’s, Rack and Stack of the DC equipment/cable
* Excellent communications are mandatory in English and Local language


**Desired Educational Requirements:**
* Completion of CompTIA certifications—e.g.A+, Network+, etc
* Completion (or near completion) of Microsoft certifications—e.g.MCP, MCITP, MCSE etc

title: Head of Information Technology
description:
**Head of IT Operations – Stockholm** 




  





**Plats:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Anställningsform:** 
 Tillsvidare, heltid
 



  





**Om företaget:** 




 Vi rekryterar för ett välkänt skandinaviskt varumärke som just nu genomgår en omfattande teknisk transformation. Organisationen har en stark marknadsposition och erbjuder en unik möjlighet att påverka framtidens IT-struktur.
 



  





**Om rollen:** 




 Som Head of IT Operations kommer du att leda och utveckla IT Operations-teamet och säkerställa att infrastrukturen är modern, säker och effektiv. Du blir en nyckelperson i företagets tekniska resa och får möjlighet att driva förändring i en komplex IT-miljö.
 



  





**Ansvarsområden:** 



* Driva automatisering av drift, infrastruktur och deployment samt samarbeta med utvecklingsteamet kring DevOps och moderna applikationslösningar.
* Säkerställa högkvalitativ support för incidenthantering och hålla systemen uppdaterade.
* Se till att IT-infrastrukturen uppfyller säkerhets- och regulatoriska krav samt förbättra identitets- och behörighetshantering.
* Leda och utveckla IT Operations-teamet, inklusive kompetensutveckling, lönerevisioner och budgetansvar.
* Bidra till IT-strategi, roadmap och utvecklingsinitiativ i linje med verksamhetens mål.



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av ledarskap inom IT
* Hands-on erfarenhet av Azure och on-prem-tjänster
* Kunskap om Infrastructure as Code (t.ex. Terraform eller Ansible)
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD och DevOps
* Bonus: Kunskap om IT Governance och säkerhet



  





**Varför ska du söka?** 



* Stabil organisation med stark kundbas och långsiktig lönsamhet
* Renodlad greenfield-utveckling
* Möjlighet att göra ett stort och verkligt avtryck



  





**Ansök via LinkedIn eller kontakta oss för mer information.** 




 📩 j.selen@tenthrevolution.com
 



  





**Obs:** 
 Rollen kräver flytande svenska och vi kan tyvärr inte erbjuda visumstöd.
 



  





**Nyckelord:** 
 #ITOperations #HeadOfIT #Azure #DevOps #Ledarskap #StockholmJobs #TechCareers

title: Head of Information Technology
description:
**Head of IT Operations Opportunity in Stockholm** 




  





 I am hiring for a Head of IT Operations position at a well known Scandinavian brand in Stockholm. The ideal candidate will have strong leadership experience within the IT sector, as well as documented experience with Azure and on-prem services, Infrastructure as Code, and CI/CD. Bonus points if you're coming from larger organisations with complex IT structures.
 



  





 This is a really exciting time to join as this organisation is going through a massive technical transformation, updating the entirety of their systems. This is a unique opportunity to join an already successful business and make a genuine impact on their IT.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Drive automation of operations, infrastructure, and deployments, and collaborate with the wider development team on DevOps and modern application operations.
* Ensuring high quality support for incident management and ensuring systems are up to date.
* Ensure IT infrastructure meets security and regulatory requirements, and improve identity and access management.
* Lead and develop the IT operations team with a focus on competence, conducting performance reviews, salary reviews, and managing the department budget.
* Contribute to the IT strategy, roadmap, and development initiatives whilst supporting business goals.



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* 5+ years' experience in leadership
* Hands on experience with Azure and on-prem services
* Experience with IaC (e.g. Terraform or Ansible)
* Experience with CI/CD and DevOps
* Bonus: Knowledge of IT governance and security



  





*This role requires candidates to speak fluent Swedish and cannot support visas.* 




  





**Why join?** 




  




* This is an incredibly stable organisation in terms of both customer and revenue, where employees tend to stay a very long time thanks to their dedication to company culture.
* Pure greenfield development.
* Opportunity to make a large and genuine impact.



  





**Please apply using the Easy Apply feature. If you have any questions, please email l.letchford@tenthrevolution.com. Closing date for applications will be the 21st of November 2025.**

title: Marketing Intern
description:
**📞 Marketing Intern — Client Relations & Research (Praktik)** 




  





*Are you a confident communicator looking to gain real-world experience in client outreach, marketing and relationship building? Do you have a sense of Nordic design? Do you enjoy connecting with people, conducting research, market analysis and explaining ideas clearly across different cultures and time zones?* 




  





 We're hiring interns for the Stockholm client engagement division of our international affiliates, specializing in relationship management and international communications.
 



  





**🌿 About Us** 




 We focus on building professional connections through structured outreach and relationship development. We work with clients across North America and Europe, supporting communication strategies, marketing and contact development.
 



  





 As part of the broader Swed Fintech group, and affiliates of Swiss Finance Academy and Britannica Capital we train the next generation of communication professionals and client relationship specialists.
 



  





**✨ What You'll Do** 



* Design marketing campaigns in Salesforce, CRM, Mailchimp and other outreach systems
* Make videos and other content that explains our products and services to clients
* Develop online presence
* Conduct outbound communication via phone and email with potential clients
* Research client segments and prepare outreach materials
* Assist in developing communication scripts and strategies
* Participate in training sessions and skill-building exercises
* Track communication outcomes and relationship development progress



  





**🌸 This Role Is For You If You:** 



* Are based in Sweden and fluent in English (Swedish helpful but not required)
* Have clear communication skills and are comfortable speaking on phone calls
* Are eager to learn professional communication tools and systems
* Want hands-on experience in client relations and outreach work
* Prefer practical experience over theoretical coursework



  





**🌿 Ideal Candidates Have:** 



* Background in Communications, Media Studies, Marketing, Sales, or related programs requiring practical internship experience
* Comfort with phone-based communication or customer interaction
* Design skills, sense of aesthetics
* Interest in developing professional relationship-building skills



  





**🙏 What We Offer:** 



* Office located on Östermalm in central Stockholm
* Practical experience with real client communications
* Professional development in relationship building and outreach
* Structured feedback and skill development
* Respected internship experience for your CV



  





 This is an unpaid praktik focused on professional skill development, and practical marketing and communications experience, suitable for students requiring internship credits as well as others interested in building client reach-out and relationship management skills.
 



  





**To Apply:** 
 Send CV and brief email explaining your interest in client communications work.
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm (Östermalm)
 



**Commitment:** 
 Full-time preferred but Part-time considered
 



**Language:** 
 English required, Swedish helpful
 



**Timeline:** 
 Rolling applications
 



 This is Swedish
 **Praktik** 
 : This has an educational and professional development component so it is unpaid.

title: IT-Specialist
description:
Vill du vara med och skapa trygghet, smarta IT-lösningar och långsiktigt värde för företag? Wiig Data söker en IT-specialist som vill ta ett helhetsgrepp, från operativ support och implementering till rådgivning och affärsutveckling. Här får du kombinera tekniskt kunnande med affärsmannaskap och vara med och forma framtidens IT-tjänster.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som IT-specialist hos Wiig Data blir du en nyckelperson i arbetet med att utveckla och leverera moderna IT-tjänster till deras kunder. Du arbetar både strategiskt och hands-on med rådgivning, support och implementering av molnbaserade lösningar, främst Microsoft 365. Samtidigt bidrar du till att utveckla processer, rutiner och erbjudanden inom IT-området.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter** 



* Ge IT-support och rådgivning inom molntjänster, drift, säkerhet och backup
* Migrera och implementera Microsoft 365 / SharePoint
* Utföra behovsanalyser av kunders IT-miljöer och föreslå rätt lösningar
* Dokumentera kundmiljöer och ta fram process- och mallstrukturer
* Utveckla och implementera underhålls- och supportavtal
* Bidra i affärsutvecklingen av Wiig Datas IT-tjänsteområde



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Du är en lösningsorienterad och affärsmässig person som trivs i kunddialoger och vill göra skillnad. Du har ett brett tekniskt kunnande och har en förmåga att se helheten och skapa värde för både kunder och verksamhet.
 



  





**Du har** 
 :
 


* Djup kunskap och praktisk erfarenhet av Microsoft 365 (Teams, Outlook, SharePoint, OneDrive, licenser)
* Erfarenhet av SharePoint-migreringar och strukturuppsättning
* Vana att ge IT-support, både på plats och på distans
* Erfarenhet av behovsanalyser och rådgivning mot kund
* God dokumentationsvana (mallar, checklistor, processer)
* Förmåga att skapa struktur och rutiner
* B-körkort



  





**Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:** 



* Projektledning och att leverera projekt till kund
* Affärssystemet Pyramid Business Studio
* Certifieringar inom Microsoft 365



  





**Intresserad av att ansöka eller få veta mer?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Wiig Data med Computer Sweden Recruitment. Vid intresse eller frågor kontakta Britta Liljegren, Rekryteringskonsult på 070-771 18 11,
 **britta.liljegren@csrecruitment.se** 
 eller Maria Widegren, Rekryteringskonsult på 073-423 15 50, maria.widegren@csrecruitment.se
 



 För att ansöka, vänligen skicka in ditt CV eller ansök med Linkedin.
 



  





**Om Wiig Data** 




 Wiig Data har hjälpt företag att effektivisera sina verksamheter sedan slutet av 80-talet.
 



 Vi är en helhetspartner inom affärssystem (Pyramid Business Studio) och IT-tjänster, med kunder inom bland annat handel, tillverkning, entreprenad och tjänstesektorn.
 



  





 Hos oss får du vara en del av ett familjärt team med bred kompetens, där vi värdesätter trygghet, ansvar, nyfikenhet och ärlighet – och där vi tillsammans skapar lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder.

title: Infrastructure Expert inom Hosting
description:
Vår kund söker en erfaren
 **Infrastructure Expert inom Hosting** 
 för ett uppdrag med start i december. Rollen ingår i ett IT-team med fokus på drift och utveckling av hosting- och nätverkslösningar. Uppdraget syftar till att täcka ett tillfälligt resursbehov och säkerställa fortsatt stabilitet, säkerhet och prestanda i kundens infrastrukturmiljö.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning / arbetsuppgifter**
**Som Konsult Kommer Du Att**
* Hantera service requests kopplade till infrastruktur och hostingtjänster
* Drifta och underhålla hostingplattformar med fokus på säkerhet, tillgänglighet och effektivitet
* Arbeta med sårbarhetshantering (vulnerability management)
* Delta i livscykelhantering och interna projekt kopplade till hostingplattformen
* Designa, planera och implementera nya hostingtjänster
* Samarbeta nära IT Hosting & Network-teamet för att säkerställa en stabil tjänsteleverans


**Skallkrav**
* Flera års erfarenhet av drift och förvaltning av MS Windows Server OS
* God erfarenhet av virtualiseringsplattformar (VMware och/eller Microsoft Hyper-V)
* Kunskap om fysisk server- och lagringshårdvara
* Erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem, gärna ServiceNow
* Grundläggande nätverkskunskaper
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet från större, komplexa IT-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av arbete i globala organisationer med höga krav på säkerhet och driftsäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av automatisering eller scriptning inom serverdrift


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Stark lagspelare med god samarbetsförmåga
* Kommunikativ och strukturerad
* Lösningsorienterad med förmåga att arbeta självständigt
* Noggrann och ansvarstagande


**Start, slut, omfattning och plats**
**Start:** 
 11 december 2025
   

  

**Slut:** 
 31 juli 2026 (möjlighet till förlängning upp till 12 månader)
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 24 timmar per vecka
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Stockholm (Sveavägen 44), med möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 2 dagar/vecka efter första månaden

title: Technical Support Specialist - Tier 1 support
description:
At Bluebeam, we empower people to advance the way the world is built. We create smart software solutions that make construction sites more efficient, connected and safe and improve the lives of design and construction professionals everywhere.
 



  





 The
 **Technical Support Specialist** 
 , a mid-level Tier 1 software support position, is expected to assist Bluebeam customers via via telephone, chat and email who require help in managing the software licenses and subscriptions of their Bluebeam products, as well as assisting with basic product usage questions. It is essential that the Technical Support Specialist partner with the customer at a professional level, provide effective resources or solutions within a reasonable amount of time, and contribute regularly to the general improvement of the team and the customer experience. This role will be supporting customers across the Nordics and broader EMEA region, and applicants must be fluent/native level Swedish speakers.
 



  





 This role is a salaried Fixed Term Contract
 



  





**About the Role** 



* Serve as a mid-level member of our Tier 1 support team by answering telephone calls, chat inquiries, and emails from our customers with little assistance.
* Responds to questions and Account Management requests for Bluebeam software applications
* Takes ownership of Account issues from initial report to final resolution, updating Account Management systems with accurate data
* Assists with basic product usage questions and escalates issues as needed
* Tracks customer interactions and contact data in CRM.
* Qualifies issues and gathers information about the scope, history and details for escalation.
* Create support documentation to be used internally as well as for customers.
* Demonstrate professional maturity, take initiative and be consistently reliable
* Assist with other miscellaneous projects as assigned to support Bluebeam philosophies and goals



  





**About You** 



* Good customer service background, preferably in a technical field.
* Knowledge of software licensing would be highly beneficial.
* Must be a native level Swedish speaker
* Customer service skills. Bluebeam has exceptional standards for customer service, not only for the clients we support, but also for our employees. It is our expectation that the person in this role will like to work with others and will help them solve problems with a positive attitude and helpful spirit.
* Attention to Detail. There are a lot of nuances to Bluebeam product account policies and procedures. It is important that team members operate with accuracy and consistency in adherence to these policies and procedures.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* Strong logical problem-solving skills. Ability to understand the question/issue, identify knowns, unknowns and apply product knowledge to ask qualifying questions to determine appropriate steps to move towards and achieve resolution



**What we offer** 



* People-focused, entrepreneurial culture with the backing of a stable, global, corporate entity – Nemetschek
* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* Work-life balance fostered through a culture of diversity, inclusion, and appreciation of individual lifestyle needs
* Opportunity for continuous professional development
* Free & unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning



  





  





**Below is our DEIBA (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Belonging, and Accessibility) mission statement:** 




 Bluebeam is committed to building an inclusive environment in which everyone, regardless of background, has an opportunity to experience a deep sense of belonging. Each of our unique perspectives amplifies our collective power, and by encouraging diverse perspectives in an environment infused with mutual respect, we arrive at better solutions. And when we bring the best version of ourselves to work, we can make our best contributions to the global community of people who build our world.
 



  





**About Bluebeam** 




 The construction industry is adopting new technology at a feverish pace. Tablets and cell phones are replacing paper blueprints, drones are surveying jobsites in 3D, and cloud collaboration is changing the way teams work together. Bluebeam plays a crucial role in this transformation. The key to our success is a customer-focused approach to product development: we work with the industry to create solutions for the industry. Today, over 3 million people throughout the world use Bluebeam. In the US, we’re a critical partner for the majority of top AEC firms, and rapidly expanding our presence globally, with offices in Sweden, Germany and the UK.
 



 Come design and build your future with us!
 



  





***Bluebeam is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.***




  





 #LI-MB1 #LI-Bluebeam

title: Teknisk Supportmedarbetare
description:
**Nu söker vi en teknisk supportmedarbetare till vårt service- och supportteam** 
  
 



  





 Är du en tekniskt intresserad person som gillar att lösa problem, stötta kollegor och ge förstklassig service? Då kan det här vara rollen för dig! 
 



  





 Som
 **teknisk supportmedarbetare** 
 blir du en viktig del av vårt serviceteam. Du fungerar som stöd både för våra
 **fälttekniker** 
 och för våra
 **kunder inom printmjukvara och mjukvarulösningar** 
 . Rollen passar dig som trivs i en kombination av teknik och service.  
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden** 
  
 



  




* Ge teknisk support till fälttekniker och slutkunder gällande både hårdvara och mjukvara.
* Arbeta med printlösningar – installation, felsökning och support (oftast på distans).
* Föreslå och genomföra åtgärder vid tekniska problem.
* Vid behov hantera eskaleringar till vårt europeiska huvudkontor eller externa leverantörer.
* Stötta teamet internt genom att hantera incidentärenden och vid behov bistå andra funktioner inom serviceteamet.



  
 



**Din bakgrund och erfarenhet** 
  
 


* Du har helst en bakgrund inom
 **print, IT-support och/eller som tekniker** 
 .
* Du trivs med att ha
 **kundkontakt** 
 och kommunicerar obehindrat med både tekniker, IT-avdelningar och eller våra säljkanaler.
* Du har
 **grundläggande kunskaper i Office 365** 
 .



  
 



**Dina personliga egenskaper** 
  
 



  





 Vi söker dig som är en
 **lagspelare** 
 med förmåga att ta eget ansvar och driva uppgifter i mål. 
 



 Du arbetar
 **strukturerat** 
 och gillar när det är ordning och reda. 
 



 Du är en
 **kommunikativ och analytisk problemlösare** 
 som är nyfiken och ständigt vill utveckla dina kunskaper om nya produkter och mjukvarulösningar. 
 



  





 Blir du nyfiken på rollen eller har du frågor innan du skickar din ansökan?  
 



  





 Skicka ett mail till rekryterande chef Service & Support Manager Stefan Karlsson (stefan.karlsson@dnr.kyocera.com) eller HR-chef Susanne Holmgren (susanne.holmgren@dnr.kyocera.com). 
 



  





  





*Om Kyocera Document Solutions Nordic AB* 
  
 



  





*Kyocera Document Solutions Nordic AB är ett dotterbolag till Kyocera Document Solutions Inc., en global ledande leverantör av kompletta dokumentlösningar med huvudkontor i Osaka, Japan. Företagets portfölj omfattar pålitliga och miljövänliga multifunktionsskrivare och skrivare, samt affärsapplikationer och konsulttjänster som gör det möjligt för kunder att optimera och hantera sina dokumentflöden och nå nya nivåer av effektivitet. Med professionell expertis och en kultur av empatisk samverkan är företagets mål att hjälpa organisationer att omsätta kunskap i praktiken för att driva förändring.* 
  
 


* *Kyocera Document Solutions Inc. är ett dotterbolag till Kyocera Corporation (Kyocera), en ledande leverantör av industri- och fordonskomponenter, halvledarförpackningar, elektroniska enheter, smarta energisystem, skrivare, kopiatorer och mobiltelefoner. Under räkenskapsåret som avslutades den 31 mars 2025 uppgick företagets konsoliderade omsättning till 2 biljoner yen (cirka 13,5 miljarder USD). Kyocera är rankad som nummer 874 på Forbes tidskrifts lista “Global 2000” över världens största börsnoterade företag 2024, och har utsetts till en av “The World’s 100 Most Sustainably Managed* 
*Companies* 
*” av The Wall Street Journal.*

title: Fullstack developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Several years of experience in backend development (preferably in cloud environments, e.g., AWS).
* Strong skills in API development (REST, WebSocket).
* Strong skills in Java, .Net and Python
* Experience with DevOps, CI/CD, and cloud operations (GitLab, AWS).
* Experience with test automation and quality assurance.
* Meritorious: experience from the automotive or autonomous systems sector.
* Independent, communicative, and used to working in agile teams.


**Application deadline:** 
 10-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Linux Operations Engineer
description:
Company: US3 Consulting
 



 About Company: US3 Consulting is a leading European IT recruitment agency dedicated to connecting top tech talent with innovative companies across the continent. With decades of experience and a fresh approach, we specialize in rapid, cost-effective candidate sourcing across all tech industry sectors. Our expert consultants are committed to building strong, productive relationships, ensuring the perfect fit between candidates and employers.
 



  





 Job Title: Senior Linux Operations Engineer
 



 Total Experience Required: 10+ years in Information Technology/Computers/Software
 



 Relevant Experience Required: 8+ years in Linux Administration within large and complex IT
 



 environments.
 



 Job Type: Contract
 



 Contract Duration: A minimum duration of 6 months, with the possibility of extension up to 18 months or beyond, depending on project requirements.
 



 Workplace Type: Hybrid (at least 3 times a week at office)
 



 Languages Required: English.
 



 Visa/Work Authorization Status: Candidates must hold a valid work permit or visa to work in Sweden
 



 Work Location: Stockholm, Sweden
 


1. Must be currently based in Sweden or
2. Willing to relocate to Sweden from anywhere within Europe or the UK
3. Candidates outside Europe/UK unfortunately cannot be considered



  





 About Client: Client offers a dynamic environment where innovation and professional growth are at the forefront. With a strong emphasis on continuous learning, the company provides employees access to extensive training programs, including LinkedIn Learning and an Education Assistance Program.
 



  





 The company champions a balanced work-life culture, promoting flexible work hours and a supportive atmosphere that values diversity and inclusion. As a part of the esteemed group, it combines global opportunities with a commitment to employee well-being, making it an ideal workplace for those seeking both professional excellence and personal fulfillment.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Operate and support on-premise Red Hat Linux infrastructure.
* Manage daily maintenance, on-call activities, and operational incidents.
* Plan and implement changes related to incidents, improvements, and lifecycle management including upgrades and migrations.
* Automate operational tasks to improve efficiency and reliability.
* Provide expert guidance on Linux services and produce technical documentation.
* Participate in or lead small-scale initiatives and collaborate in projects as a Linux specialist.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with organisational goals.



  





**Essential Skills:** 



* Strong expertise in Red Hat Linux (on-premise and cloud).
* Hands-on experience with automation tools such as Ansible.
* Scripting capabilities using Bash and either Perl or Python.
* Proficiency in data centre technologies and IT service management frameworks such as ITIL.
* Good understanding of cloud concepts, ideally Azure, and SaaS, PaaS, IaaS models.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently in an international team.
* Excellent English communication skills.



  





**Optional Skills:** 



* Experience within international environments and DevOps methodologies.
* Linux certifications such as RHCE.
* Related technology certifications including VMware



  





 Interested? Apply Now!
 



 📧 Send your resume to: sowmya@us3consulting.nl
 







 🔁 Not a fit for you? Share this with someone in your network who might be interested!
 



 🔗 Connect: linkedin.com/in/sowmyakotamarthy
 



 🌐 Visit our homepage: https://www.us3consulting.co.uk
 



 🔗 Follow us on LinkedIn for more exciting opportunities:https://www.linkedin.com/company/us3-consulting
 



  





 #RedHatLinux #LinuxAdministration #OperationalEngineer #ITInfrastructure #Automation #Ansible #Bash #Python #ITIL #CloudOperations #Azure #DataCentre #SaaS #IaaS #PaaS #Troubleshooting #ContractRole #StockholmJobs #ITJobsSweden

title: Cloud Architect
description:
🌐 Azure/AWS Cloud Architect – Stockholm & Malmö
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm / Malmö (Hybrid – minimum 3 days onsite, sometimes 5 depending on project phase)
 



  





**Language Requirements:** 
 Swedish & English (fluency required)
 



  





**Citizenship:** 
 Swedish citizens only (single citizenship, due to security clearance requirements with certain clients)
 



  





**About the Company** 




  





 Join one of Europe’s most established and trusted IT consultancies, with 50,000 employees across 30 countries and 600 colleagues in Sweden. With a strong financial foundation, consistent project pipeline, and a reputation for delivering on critical digital transformation initiatives in
 **government, telecom, defence, healthcare, and energy** 
 , this is an opportunity to build your career within socially impactful projects that shape the future of Sweden.
 



  





 You’ll be part of a team of 20+ cloud specialists (majority in Stockholm, with presence in Malmö), working with industry leaders like
 **Telia, Vattenfall, and Region Stockholm** 
 on complex and high-visibility assignments.
 



  





**The Role - Cloud Architect** 




  





 As a
 **hands-on Cloud Architect** 
 , you will translate business needs into scalable, secure, and cost-efficient cloud solutions across Azure and AWS. You’ll be both technical and advisory, acting as a trusted expert for clients while collaborating closely with developers, project managers, and stakeholders.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* **Architecture & Design:** 
 Define and implement secure, scalable, and cost-optimized architectures using frameworks like CAF, WAF, and Security Reference Architecture.
* **Infrastructure as Code:** 
 Build and manage solutions with Terraform, Bicep, ARM, CloudFormation, and CDK.
* **Automation & Optimization:** 
 Drive automation of workflows, deployments, and operations with Azure DevOps, AWS CodePipeline, GitHub Actions, or Jenkins.
* **Advisory & Collaboration:** 
 Partner with clients as a trusted advisor, supporting them through their cloud adoption journeys.
* **Security & Governance:** 
 Apply best practices in security, compliance, and governance across enterprise environments.
* **DevOps & Scripting:** 
 Contribute to CI/CD and automation initiatives using PowerShell, Bash, or Python.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




  




* 7+ years’ experience in cloud solution design and implementation (Azure and/or AWS).
* Proven ability to translate business needs into technical architecture with focus on
 **security, scalability, cost-efficiency, and performance** 
 .
* Practical knowledge of cloud adoption frameworks (Microsoft CAF, AWS WAF, Security Reference Architecture).
* Experience with
 **CI/CD tools** 
 (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, CodePipeline).
* Container knowledge (Docker, Kubernetes) – a strong plus.
* Consultancy background and pre-sales experience – meritorious.
* Relevant certifications (Azure Solutions Architect Expert, AWS Solutions Architect Professional, etc.) – essential.
* **Swedish fluency and Swedish citizenship** 
 .



  





**What’s in it for You?** 




  





 ✔ A financially stable, global consultancy with
 **long-term career development** 
 opportunities
 



 ✔ Access to
 **socially critical projects** 
 that make a difference in Sweden
 



 ✔ Work with the
 **latest cloud technologies** 
 in large-scale enterprise environments
 



 ✔ Competitive package:
 


* **6 weeks vacation**
* **Wellness allowance**
* **ITP pension**
* **Hybrid working model (min. 3 days onsite)**
* Collective agreement & full office equipment



  





 Why Apply?
 



  





 This is a unique opportunity to join a
 **well-known, respected consultancy brand** 
 with the scale, stability, and client trust to secure projects in
 **defence, government, and critical infrastructure** 
 . You’ll not only architect solutions but also see the real impact of your work on Sweden’s digital transformation.
 



  





 👉 Apply today and become part of a
 **team of cloud experts driving innovation in critical sectors across Sweden** 
 .

title: Linux Operation
description: Senior Operational Engineer (Linux) you will work in an international team, operating mainly our Red Hat on premise environment. The Operational Engineer drives complex changes, actively supports new implementations, and cares for service improvement through problem management. Act as a point of contact for all technical questions regarding the Linux related services. title: Technical Tester to Payments
description:
Would you like to help build Swedbank’s next generation’s payment platform?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Help test and maintain critical services and functionality within the super-hot payments area.
* Take part in the largest transformation of Swedbank’s payment infrastructure in decades.
* Analyse product requirements, technical impacts, system processes and solution designs.
* Write unit, functional and end-to-end tests, acceptance criteria, KPI's and test scenarios to measure the quality of our payment infrastructure.
* Take part in non-functional and performance testing to help scale up the environment for large transaction volumes.
* Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to communicate system status to Swedbanks management, suppliers and other stakeholders.
* Be part of a cross functional agile team in the Payment Execution Agile Release Train that run the SAFe agile framework.
* Work closely and learn from domain experts in payments, architecture and mainframe systems.
* Develop yourself, contribute to the development of your team and the entire release train.
* Be part of a dynamic environment with cross functional teams that share challenges and build knowledge together


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Knowledge of methods and tools used in software testing.
* Experience from banking, finance or insurance industries.
* Work experience from the payment domain is an advantage.
* Experience from ongoing initiatives such as ISO20022, Bank/plusgiro transformation, SEPA or similar is helpful.
* A team player with good collaboration and communication skills.
* Experience from agile ways of working, e.g. SAFe, scrum etc.
* Ability to communicate with IT and business stakeholders to reach a common understanding of the work that needs to be done.
* A driven, proactive, self-organized and an analytical approach with a strive to continuously improve.
* Proficient in English, spoken and written, Swedish is a plus.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 be part of the largest transformation of the payments area in decades. Learn a critical area for the bank and help building our new future infrastructure for payments. Work in an open atmosphere based on collaboration, curiosity and building knowledge.”
 **Sambath Kumar Shanmugam, your future manager**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 14.11.2025.
   

  

**Location: Stockholm, Sundbyberg**
**Recruiting manager:
 **Sambath Kumar Shanmugam****
 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Sales Associate, Stockholm - part-time
description:
**Join Our Growing Team**
**BE AWAKE FOR THE FIRST TIME IN YOUR LIFE**
 At Hästens, we strive for a world where people sleep well – one that’s more joyful, peaceful and loving. Every day since 1852, we continue to hone our world-class craft in our factory in Köping, Sweden. Sleep may be today’s ultimate modern luxury. But it’s more than that; it’s a biological necessity and the foundation of our entire wellbeing. We want people to sleep well so that they can create the future they dream of upon waking. That’s why our master craftsmen consider and handcraft every detail of our bespoke designs using only the finest natural materials.
   

  

 We are proud to be a world-class international brand, operating in more than 40 countries with over 300 partners in Europe, Asia, America and Africa – and still growing.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Providing exceptional customer service to every client, ensuring they receive personalized attention and assistance throughout their shopping experience.
* Actively engaging with clients through outreach initiatives and creative events to drive sales and expand the customer base.
* Serving as a brand ambassador for Hästens, promoting our products and services with enthusiasm and professionalism.
* Leading by example, delivering outstanding customer service and sales performance.
* Ensuring the Hästens store environment is welcoming, organized, and visually appealing to enhance the shopping experience.
* Continuously seeking opportunities for self-improvement and staying updated on industry trends and product knowledge to better serve clients.


**Skills And Requirements**
* Bachelor's or master's degree from university.
* Drivers’ license
* Sales Experience with demonstrated success in a sales-driven environment, with a track record of achieving or exceeding sales targets.
* CRM experience.
* Proactive Attitude and self-motivated, proactive approach to sales, with the initiative to seek out new opportunities and drive business growth.
* Customer Service Excellence with strong interpersonal skills and a genuine passion for providing exceptional customer service. Ability to listen attentively to clients' needs and offer tailored solutions.
* Verbal and written proficiency in local language and English.
* Clear and effective communication skills, both verbal and written, to articulate product features and benefits, as well as build rapport with clients.
* Relationship Building Ability to cultivate trusting relationships with clients and colleagues, fostering loyalty and collaboration.
* Willingness to work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays, to accommodate the needs of the business and clients.


**About Us**
 Since 1852, Hästens Beds has been committed to crafting the best sleep. The skilled craftspeople at our factory in Köping, Sweden, have been refining our work for generations. Every bed is bespoke and made by hand using only the best natural materials. The difference lies in the details and our quest to provide the most restful sleep for people who want to lead a higher quality of life. We are proud to be a world-class international brand, operating in more than 40 countries with over 300 partners in Europe, Asia, America and Africa – and still growing.
   

  

**Compensation & Benefits**
 We offer a comprehensive and competitive salary and benefits program.

title: PR & Influencer Lead
description:
**Job Description**
 As a
 **PR & Influencer Lead to Weekday** 
 you will define, develop and execute PR and influencer strategies in collaboration with specialists. You will support channel owners with initiatives, prioritization, and new ways of working to expand and drive measurable success. You will lead projects from concept to delivery, including timelines and production
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Monitor performance across all funnel stages and optimize based on insights
* Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external partners
* Manage budgets and ensure effective allocation across channels
* Refine ROI frameworks, reporting, and activation plans for PR and influencer activities
* Research trends and drive innovation to enhance brand relevance and revenue growth
* Contribute to brand-defining moments and key campaigns


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You will collaborate closely with channel owners, creative teams, and external partners to deliver impactful PR and influencer initiatives. At Weekday, we work in a fast-paced environment where creativity meets strategy, ensuring our brand stays relevant and resonates with our audience.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with…
   

  

* 5 -10 years of experience in PR and influencer marketing, preferably within fashion or lifestyle brands.
* Strong understanding of earned media and creator channels.
* Proven ability to manage budgets and measure ROI


 And people who are…
   

  

* Fashion-savvy with strong commercial awareness
* Creative and strategic thinkers
* Structured, organized, and detail-oriented
* Strong communicators and relationship builders
* Proactive leaders who thrive in a dynamic environment


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **full-time permanent position** 
 based at our Head Office in Stockholm.
   

  

 If you feel this opportunity is exciting, feel free to apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible, but no later than
 **5th Nov 2025** 
 . Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

 In this role, you will have the flexibility to work both remotely and from the office. While remote working is part of our offer, approx. 4 days per week office presence is required to foster strong collaborations and teamwork.
   

  

**Please note** 
 this position is offered on a local contract, therefore you should have the legal right to work in Sweden before applying. Other candidates are welcome to register their interest, and we will keep you in mind for future opportunities.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Weekday/Monki
   

  

**Weekday** 
 is where culture moves fast and expression runs deep. Your everyday remix wrapped in denim. Too much, not enough, perfect. A wardrobe of contrasts: Effortless basics, monochrome shades, and edgy cuts. The signature jeans that go with everything—and express it all. More than fashion - it’s a moment, a mood, culture in motion. Every version, all at once.
   

  

**Monki** 
 is a state of mind, wearing the moods all the time. From hot basics to It-dresses and skirts, wild prints to match whatever feels right. It’s about the energy, the fierce force that’s always on point and ever-present. It’s being curious —imagining it, making it real, because style is never just one thing. Learn more about Weekday here.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 We offer all our employees attractive benefits with broad development opportunities. All our employees receive a staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to this, Weekday-based colleagues also receive:
   

  

* 30 days holiday
* A collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* Wellness benefit 3000kr/year
* Benify Benefits Portal


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Data Engineer (Databricks)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Insights & Data team is at the forefront of this mission, delivering end-to-end Data & AI solutions across industries. With 550 specialists in the Nordics, we leverage strategic partnerships with Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks, and Snowflake to scale Data & Analytics in the Cloud. Here, your expertise and perspective matter - join us in driving innovation and transforming industries with cutting-edge data solutions!
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Data Engineer with a Databricks focus, you will be building scalable and secure data platforms. You will leverage your expertise in Databricks, Apache Spark, as well as Azure to design, develop, and implement data warehouses, data lakehouses, and AI/ML models that fuel our data-driven operations.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key part in:*
* Designing and building high-performance data pipelines: Utilize Databricks and Apache Spark to extract, transform, and load data into Azure Data Lake Storage and other Azure services.
* Develop and maintain secure data warehouses and data lakehouses: Implement data models, data quality checks, and governance practices to ensure reliable and accurate data.
* Building and deploying AI/ML models: Integrate Machine Learning into data pipelines, leverage Databricks ML and Azure ML to develop predictive models and drive business insights.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with business analysts, data scientists, and DevOps engineers to ensure successful data platform implementations.


**Your profile**
* Professional experience of working with Data Engineering
* Fluent Swedish skills - you have the ability to communicate in a professional context
* Proven expertise in Databricks, Apache Spark, and data pipeline development and strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and practices.
* Experience with Microsoft Azure cloud platform, including Azure Data Lake Storage, Databricks, and Azure Data Factory.
* Knowledge of SQL and scripting languages like Python and hands-on experience with AI/ML concepts and tools.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We partner with names such as Google, Microsoft, Amazon and Databricks, which can equip you with valuable certifications in the latest technologies in line with your ambitions.


**Your Application**
*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.*
 Welcome to apply!
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Digital Customer Experience Lead
description:
**WHO WE ARE** 





 At Trustly, we're building a smarter, faster, and more secure financial future by revolutionizing the world of payments. As a global leader in Open Banking Payments, we are establishing Pay by Bank as the new standard at checkout, providing unparalleled freedom, speed, and ease to millions of consumers and merchants worldwide.
 




  






 Our Ambition: To build the world’s most disruptive payment network and redefine what the payment experience should feel like.
 




  






 Trustly is a global team of innovators, collaborators, and doers.  If you are driven by a strong sense of purpose and thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial, and high-growth environment, join us and be part of a team that’s transforming the way the world pays.
 




  





**About the role
 
 As a Digital Customer Experience Lead at Trustly you will help to define and drive the evolution of our digital experiences for the services organization. Digital experiences encompass external support sites, content, bots, communities, SEO, and future technologies, of which many will be built from the ground up. You are passionate about technology and leveraging the power of data & AI/ML to drive digital platforms. We are looking for someone that loves our customers and cares deeply about solving for the different customer cohorts that we serve.  You should be familiar with various digital support experiences and what needs to happen to make them great. 
 



  





**About the team
 
 You will be part of a collaborative and forward-thinking Customer Support leadership team that focuses on improving processes, tools, and the overall customer experience. The team works together to identify opportunities for efficiency and ensure smooth operations across all support channels.
 



  





 In this role, you will report directly to the Director of Customer Service and contribute to projects that enhance performance, quality, and customer satisfaction. It is a dynamic and supportive environment where ideas are shared freely, and everyone works toward the common goal of delivering excellent service.
 




  




**What you'll do** 
* Assess the current state of digital experiences, define a clear future vision, and translate it into a well-structured, actionable roadmap
* Leverage AI/ML capabilities to enhance and evolve customer experiences, with a proven ability to apply these technologies effectively
* Evaluate the technology stack supporting digital experiences and recommend platform investments that align with strategic goals
* Define user stories and acceptance criteria to execute against the roadmap, continuously driving improvement through iteration
* Prioritize work based on potential impact, manage dependencies effectively, and ensure high-value delivery
* Provide hands-on support to configure or troubleshoot platforms when needed - comfortable diving into technical details to ensure experiences are delivered to specifications
* Apply a data-driven mindset to define KPIs for each platform and ensure accurate, actionable reporting
* Collaborate cross-functionally with teams across the organization to align and deliver best-in-class customer experiences



  




**Who you are** 
* 5+ years of experience in product management within a technical environment, working closely with development team
* 5+ years working in digital support, with breadth of exposure to various digital support channels
* Proven track record of improving digital customer experiences with measurable business impact
* Strong experience in defining success metrics and leading reporting enhancements to accurately reflect digital performance
* Sound judgment and decision-making skills, with the ability to balance user needs and business priorities
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills
* Collaborative, solution-oriented mindset with a proactive and supportive approach to problem-solving
* Self-motivated and accountable, with the ability to work independently and deliver high-quality outcomes on time






  




  


**Our Fantastic Benefits**

 (varies by location)
 




 🌴
 **20 to 30 days of holiday** 
 to support a healthy work-life balance
 



 🥳
 **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



 👶
 **Parental leave top-up** 
 additional support for new parents
 



 🥐
 **Daily breakfast and on-site perks** 
 to make your workday smoother
 



 💚
 **Well being support** 
 our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best
 



**PLUS** 
 additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!
 



  





**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact**




 Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.
 



 If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Apply now and submit your CV in English.******

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**VNTRS is growing!**
 We are now looking for a Senior Data Engineer who is passionate about innovation & data. Do you want to be part of a team that uses the latest technologies and grows our business in both Sweden and internationally? Do you have great engineering and analytics skills and would like to work with inspiring people? Then for sure you will enjoy working with us at VNTRS!
   

  

**About VNTRS**
 Creating successful companies together with our clients is at the heart and soul of VNTRS. We believe that too many great ideas fall short due to the wrong reasons – we exist to change that. We are consultants but we don’t consider ourselves as such. We think that we get the best chances to reach success by becoming partners with our clients and working together as one team.
   

  

 We are currently 30+ coworkers and at VNTRS we like to share risks and have skin in the game. To partner up with promising entrepreneurs/corporations and share the risk and upside together with all our co-workers is one of the cornerstones of VNTRS.
   

  

**About The Job**
 Working at VNTRS as a Senior Data Engineer you can expect a lot of diversity in your daily tasks (engineering, advising clients, strategic solutions...). You will mostly be working closely with external clients, with some work including startups from our portfolio.
   

  

 We will actively let you work on exciting projects to broaden your skillset. Within the assignments, you will be using a wide range of data engineering technologies, while also being a core part of cross-functional teams.
   

  

 Depending on the assignment, your opinion will have a big impact when it comes to the solution, but also the scoping of the whole process such as prioritisation, techstacks and architecture.
   

  

**Must-have Requirements**
 At least
 **5** 
 years of experience working as a data engineer / BI engineer
   

  

 Data warehousing - Ex: Microsoft Azure Synapse, Google BigQuery, Amazon Redshift, Snowflake,
   

  

 Data modeling & architecture
   

  

 ETL (Extract, Transform & Load)
   

  

 Programming & Scripting - Ex: Python, SQL, Scala, Java, C#
   

  

 API & Data Integration
   

  

 Cloud - Preferably Azure (Data Factory, Synapse Analytics)
   

  

 Fluent in English & Swedish
   

  

 Pragmatic, Self-acting and a people person
   

  

**Nice-to-have Requirements**
 Business Intelligence & Data Visualization Tools - Ex: Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Qlik Sense
   

  

 Big Data Processing - Ex: Apache Spark, Databricks, Hadoop, Google Dataflow
   

  

 Data Governance & Quality - Data Cataloging, GDPR Compliance, Data Lineage Tools (Collibra, Alation)
   

  

 Previous consulting experience
   

  

 Bachelors or master’s degree
   

  

**Additional Information**
*Amazing equity & bonus programme:*
 All co-workers get the exclusive right to invest in the portfolio of startups that we all work with.
   

  

**Coaching Mindset And Mandate To Make Change**
 We believe in a flat organisation where everybody is shaping VNTRS. You will get real responsibility from day one. Together we create a personal development plan based on your career goals and give you the senior support you need to achieve them.
   

  

*Having fun and work-life balance!*
 At VNTRS we really believe in having fun at work and encourage a healthy work-life balance with a flexible hybrid way of working. Every other Friday we all gather for a social lunch and every other Wednesday breakfast is served - both of which are on the house. At the end of the week we also have a common after-work at the office. We also have two yearly conferences!
   

  

**Generous Benefits**
 On top of our amazing equity programme, 5000 kr in wellness grant, educational bonus and parental leave top up during 6 months are some of our hidden perks.
   

  

**Application**
 If you're ready to play a key role in VNTRS's tech revolution, we want to hear from you. Apply now to contribute to the future success of VNTRS and our clients.
   

  

 VNTRS is a venture studio that helps entrepreneurs and large corporations to build innovative digital products and services. In some cases we invest part of our fee in exchange for equity, so-called sweat equity investments.
   

  

 Our team consists of software developers, UI/UX designers, product and project managers, brand experts, and growth specialists.

title: Mobile QA Test Engineer
description:
```html
 



**About the Company** 




  





  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day. We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




  





  





 We're looking for a QA Engineer with strong expertise in iOS mobile testing and automation, ready to contribute to a highly collaborative and forward-thinking QA Guild. Your work will be instrumental in ensuring quality across the full development lifecycle. You will help implement disciplined automation strategies, reinforce structured risk analysis, and maintain a robust testing framework shared across brands, all orchestrated via CI/CD pipelines owned by our platform team.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 




  





  




* Drive end-to-end QA practices in an Agile sprint cycle: story analysis, automation hook planning, test execution, and post-sprint release validation.
* Execute and expand automated test suites using Behave + Appium (XCUITest driver) integrated via Fastlane.
* Participate in daily triage of Nightly Sanity runs and coordinate targeted regression testing for high-risk PRs.
* Investigate flaky tests, analyze visual regressions, and debug failures using Allure reports, video logs, and console output.
* Collaborate across brands by running tests on any of the six iOS apps in shared CI environments.
* Actively contribute to cross-team improvements, including node-scaling PoCs, dashboard metrics, and infra health syncs.
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  





  





**Qualifications** 




  





  




* 3+ years of experience in mobile QA, preferably iOS.



  





  





**Required Skills** 




  





  




* Solid knowledge of test automation frameworks (XCUITest, Appium) and Gherkin syntax.
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools like Jenkins, Bitbucket, and Fastlane.
* Comfortable with command-line test execution and mobile device/simulator management.
* Analytical and quality-focused mindset with experience in risk-based testing.
* Experience debugging test failures with video logs and console output.
* Ability to collaborate across remote and multi-brand teams.



  





  





**Preferred Skills** 




  





  




* Experience with Grafana, Jira, Confluence is a plus.
* Valuable: Experience with proxy-based tools for inspecting and mocking network traffic.



  





  





**Pay range and compensation package** 




  





  





 [Pay range or salary or compensation]
 



  





  





**Equal Opportunity Statement** 




  





  





 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.
 



  





 ```

title: Infrastructure Engineer - Linux
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Förvalta och vidareutveckla vår Linux-miljö
* Arbeta med virtualisering (VMware), nätverk och lagring
* Samarbeta tätt med kollegor inom IT-säkerhet, utveckling och support


 Att jobba som Infrastructure Engineer - Linux
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Infrastructure Engineer med fokus på Linux som vill vara med och bygga vidare på vår tekniska plattform och bidra till att leverera Sveriges bästa bolåneupplevelse. Hos oss får du arbeta i ett snabbfotat tech-team där innovation, säkerhet och automatisering står i centrum.
   

  

 Som Infrastructure Engineer - Linux blir du en nyckelperson i vårt Tech Operations-team som brinner för teknik, samarbete och ständig förbättring.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Delta i drift och utveckling av vår Kubernetesplattform
* Automatisera med Ansible, Pipelines och scriptning (t.ex. Bash, Python)
* Bidra till ständig förbättring av våra system och processer


 Vi söker dig som är en passionerad Linux-entusiast med bred teknisk kompetens och ett stort engagemang för ditt arbete. Du har gedigen erfarenhet av Linux och OS-nära tjänster, och du är van att arbeta i komplexa, säkra och högtilgängliga miljöer. Du har goda kunskaper i Ansible, scriptning samt versionshantering med Git. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Kubernetes och containerteknik. Som person är du ansvarstagande, självgående och prestigelös. Du tar initiativ, är lösningsorienterad och trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra. Du delar gärna med dig av din kunskap och bidrar till teamets gemensamma framgång.
   

  

 Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har gym, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista. Rollen kräver att du talar svenska.
   

  

 Har du check på allt?
   

  

* Ansvarstagande
* Bra på att prioritera
* Förändringsbenägen
* Kommunikativ
* Nyfiken


 Annars då?

title: Marketing & Content Coordinator - At Six
description:
At Six is more than a hotel. It’s a house for cosmopolitan minds, a place where art, culture, and high-end hospitality meet in the heart of Stockholm.
   

  

 Now, we’re looking for a Marketing & Content Coordinator with a creative mind and strong commercial awareness to join our team and help bring the At Six brand to life across every channel. You’ll be part of a dynamic marketing team that thrives on creativity, collaboration, and storytelling - all while ensuring that every touchpoint reflects the bold and refined spirit of At Six. You’re a creative multitasker who thrives in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment, you have an eye for detail, a feel for aesthetics, and a love for creating content that tells a story.
   

  

**About Us**
 Part of Petter Stordalen’s Nordic Hotels & Resorts, At Six is a contemporary art and design hotel that redefines luxury with 343 rooms, multiple dining experiences, and 3000m² of flexible event space. Here, we blend high culture with an urban edge, creating social spaces for business, pleasure, and everything in between.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 This is a hands-on, creative, and fast-paced role for someone who loves turning ideas into visuals, stories and experiences that keeps evolving the brand of At Six. As our Marketing & Content Coordinator, you’ll work closely with and report to the Marketing Manager to plan, create, and execute content and campaigns that strengthen our presence and engagement across all platforms.
   

  

 You’ll play a key role in developing creative concepts, producing content, and ensuring that everything we publish from digital campaigns to visual assets aligns with our brand and drives commercial results. You’ll also collaborate closely with the daily operations in the house, ensuring alignment between marketing initiatives, business goals and daily operations.
   

  

 You might not currently work in hospitality, but you’re deeply connected to culture, design, and lifestyle. You’re curious, proactive, and have a strong sense for what captures people’s attention and moves them emotionally.
   

  

 Key responsibilities
   

  

* Content & Campaign Creation: Ideate, create, and produce digital content and campaigns aligned with our brand’s strategy, visual identity, tone of voice and activation calendar.
* Social Media Management: Plan, produce, and publish engaging content on Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn. Analyze performance and optimize together with our digital agency.
* Production & Brand Communication: Oversee the production of marketing materials across formats from newsletters, website updates, and digital assets to print, signage, and event visuals ensuring consistency in design, tone, and quality.
* Event & Activation Support: Ideate and support the execution of events and brand activations that connect with our guests and local community.
* Influencer Marketing: Manage incoming collaboration requests and coordinate relevant partnerships that align with our identity.
* Performance & Collaboration: Work closely with the Marketing Manager, operations and the commercial team to follow up on KPIs, analyze outcomes, and optimize campaigns for impact and conversion.


**Desired Qualifications**
* 2 - 4 years experience in marketing, communication, or content production. Ideally within lifestyle, hospitality, or culture.
* Strong understanding of social media platforms, trends, and storytelling.
* Excellent skills in graphic design (Adobe Creative Suite and/or Canva).
* Experience with photo and video production, photo editing, and simple video editing.
* Strong copywriting skills in both English and Swedish.
* A commercial mindset and the ability to think strategically.
* A passion for market trends in the hospitality, luxury and lifestyle segment
* A social team player with a proactive, positive approach and the confidence to lead creative processes.


 Ready to join the magic At Six?
   

  

 If you thrive in a dynamic environment and are eager to shape our brand's market position while fostering creativity, we want to hear from you. We pride ourselves on a supportive, diverse, and fun work environment with opportunities for career growth and the chance to make lasting friendships.
   

  

**Some Of Our Benefits**
* Four complimentary hotel nights per year at any Strawberry hotel.
* Discounts on hotel stays, food and drinks across the group.
* A dynamic, inspiring workplace in the heart of Stockholm.
* Employee and Friends & Family room rates


 If you meet the requirements and are eager to take on the next step in your career, we’d love to hear from you! Please note that we only accept applications submitted through our official recruitment page. If you have any questions, don’t hesitate to contact josefine.hedlund@hotelatsix.com.
   

  

 Interviews are ongoing - don’t wait, apply today!

title: Executive Protection Specialist
description:
Do you want to play a key role in protecting Spotify’s leadership? Spotify is hiring an
 **Executive Protection Specialist** 
 in Stockholm.
   

  

**Why this role is unique**
 This isn’t just another security job. At Spotify, you’ll be on the move, traveling extensively around the world, working in very diverse and dynamic environments, while ensuring our executives can focus fully on leading the company.
   

  

 You’ll join a culture built on collaboration, sincerity, innovation, passion, and playfulness, and become a trusted partner to leadership in moments that matter. If you’re looking for a role that combines responsibility, global travel, and constant development, we want to hear from you.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Protect Spotify’s top leaders in their daily life, during events and global travel.
* Collaborate with Executive Assistants and other teams to plan and execute operations.
* Conduct continuous risk and threat assessments.
* Support other Business Protection operations across the globe.
* Manage personnel and technical security solutions, both in Sweden and abroad.
* Be part of big and small projects across the Executive Protection scope.


 Who You Are
   

  

* Do you bring operational experience protecting people?
* Do you stay sharp when travel is demanding, information limited, and flexibility makes all the difference?
* Are you comfortable leaving your suit at home, and working discreetly, adapting to any setting?
* Are you fluent in Swedish and English and are you comfortable navigating international environments?
* Do you enjoy working with techy gadgets and staying connected while on the move?


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators.
